body.name: Corporate Computer PC Motherboard Internal Speaker by Corpco
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
features: Internal PC motherboard speaker used to hear post code beeps
Aprox 3 inch long cable, reduces PC wiring clutter
Plugs onto the Speaker header connection on the motherboard
body.description: In many instances you may not need to have a full set of multimedia speakers on your PC such as in an office environment. With this internal speaker installed you can still hear the PC boots codes as it boots to be sure everything is working correctly. You can also hear the confirmation beeps when you insert USB devices. 1 short: boot normal 1 short 1 short 1 short: initialization system power failure1 short 1 short 2 short: motherboard error 1 short 1 short 3 short: CMOS battery failure or 1 short 1 short 4 short: ROM BIOS checksum error 1 short 2 short 1 short: System clock error 1 short 2 short 2 short: DMA initialization failure1 short 2 short 3 short: DMA page register error 1 short 3 short 1 short: RAM refresh error 1 short 3 short 2 short: Basic memory error 1 Short 3 Short 3 short: Basic memory error 1 Short 4 Short 1 Short: basic memory address line error 1 Short 4 Short 2 Short: basic memory parity error 1 Short 4 Short 3 Short: EISA timing error 1 Short 4 Short 4 Short: EISA NMI port error 2 short 1 short 1 short: before the 64K base memory error 3 short 1 short 1 short: DMA register error 3 Short 1 Short 2 Short: Master DMA register error 3 short 1 short 3 short: main interrupt handling register error 3 short 1 short 4 short: slave interrupt handling register error 3 short 2 short 4 short: Keyboard controller error 3 short 1 short 3 short: main interrupt handling error register 3 short 4 short 2 short: display error 3 short 4 short 3 short: clock error 4 Short 2 Short 2 Short: shutdown error 4 short 2 short 3 short: Gate A20 error 4 Short 2 Short 4 Short: protected mode interrupt error

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.2 4.2 out of 5 stars 325 ratings 4.2 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Remember when your case used to have a little squeaker-speaker in the front, and you had to route an obnoxiously tiny-gauge wire with teensy jumpers to the motherboard in order to hear your computer beep, once, when it boots? Well, guess what? Now, you can relive that nostalgic experience, except this time routing a tiny gauge wire with teensy jumpers *with a thing dangling awkwardly off the end of it* that just flops around loosely. A++++ would buy a 10-pack. <3 <3 <3

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Worked as expected
reviews.reviewText: My computer case does not have a system warning speaker but my motherboard does have a speaker header. This item works on my system and I do get a faint single beep when I power on my system.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Does exactly what it should
reviews.reviewText: With my new computer build I got an Asus x570 Tuf Gaming motherboard which doesn't have the digital code readouts so I needed to have the system beeps just for safety. To be clear, I marked the sound quality a 5 because all this is intended for is to make the beep sounds, not play music obviously. I connected it to the system sound prongs on the motherboard and it works perfectly.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2020
reviews.reviewText: The beep speaker sounds really good. Way better than stock. However, the soldering quality is bad, it came apart. Easy to fix.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A beeper speaker - not much more to add!
reviews.reviewText: My new PC build had the connections for but didn't come with a "speaker" to announce POST beeps. This served that purpose. One minor problem is that it's wired "backwards" - black wire connected to "+" on the speaker, red to the other contact; admittedly, I'm not sure that makes any difference for a beeper speaker, just noting the mistake (can you imagine wiring these day in and day out...I'd make a simple mistake, too!)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Poor Solder Job
reviews.reviewText: If you're like me you are looking for a motherboard speaker listing with only one speaker as that is all you need and you are trying to not be wasteful. This is not the one to buy. I saw that the listing had mostly positive reviews and assumed that the negative reviews were not indicative of the product's quality as a whole; but rather the result of some poor quality control. My speaker arrived intact and working but I had to re-solder the joints just to keep it from falling apart. At this point, I would just buy one of the more competitively priced and better reviewed multi-packs. Just throw the extras in a drawer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Check online for the beeping pattern guide for your motherboard before buying.
reviews.reviewText: Well, for me personally it works, and it is louder than I expected. It should be loud enough for anyone with normal hearing to notice. For the 5-ish dollars I paid for it it was worth buying for future reference although I can't find a beep guide for my motherboard. The fact that the speaker didnt break while installing as described by other reviewers is either because people got bad units or I need to work out more. Probably both. Either way, be aware of the negative reviews because this is a pretty cheap item.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2017
